page.title: 01INTRODUCTION
page.content: The area is almost entirely residential, having a mixture of villas with terraced streets but little open space. There are also several shopping areas. Little evidence of the resort remains other than amusement arcades, small funfairs and a concert hall. The pier has been closed for many years and the ferry trip to Liverpool is a thing of the distant past. The area's residential importance has been increased by the redevelopment, for housing, of the area where New Brighton Tower once stood, and by the sub-division of larger villas. Plans exist for the development of a theme park in the promenade area, while extensive engineering works to modify the tidal flow and to improve coastal defences are nearing completion.
